entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 3:39AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Areas of Dense Fog This Morning... Areas of dense fog will affect the morning commute. Be alert for rapid changes in visibility in short distances, to below a quarter mile or less in some spots. Slow down, use low beam headlights, and leave plenty of distance between your vehicle and the one ahead of you when encountering areas of fog.

entry.summary: ...HEAT INDEX VALUES BETWEEN 105 AND 109 DEGREES ARE EXPECTED TODAY... The combination of expected air and dewpoint temperatures will result in maximum Heat Index values between 105 and 109 degrees inclusive today. In addition, Residents with outdoor activities planned are urged to drink plenty of water, wear light weight and light colored clothing and take frequent breaks from the heat.

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 13 at 4:27AM EDT until September 13 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...High risk for rip currents expected. * WHERE...In Maryland, Maryland Beaches County. In North Carolina, Eastern Currituck County. In Virginia, Virginia Beach, and Accomack and Northampton Counties.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 3:39AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Areas of Dense Fog This Morning... Areas of dense fog will affect the morning commute. Be alert for rapid changes in visibility in short distances, to below a quarter mile or less in some spots. Slow down, use low beam headlights, and leave plenty of distance between your vehicle and the one ahead of you when encountering areas of fog.

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued September 13 at 8:33AM AST until September 14 at 6:00PM AST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AST THURSDAY... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Life-threatening rip currents due to breaking waves between 6 and 11 feet, and occasionally higher. * WHERE...Beaches of Culebra, and St. Thomas, St. John and Adjacent Islands.

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued September 13 at 8:19AM AST until September 13 at 5:00PM AST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM AST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heat indices of 108 degrees or more. * WHERE...Southwest through southeast and northwest coastal areas, urban areas of the east interior of Puerto Rico, Vieques, Culebra and the Northern U.S.Virgin Islands. * WHEN...From 10 AM AST until 5 PM AST this afternoon.

entry.title: Frost Advisory issued September 13 at 5:41AM CDT until September 13 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FROST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Temperatures as low as 30 will result in frost formation. * WHERE...Portions of east central, north central and northeast Minnesota and northwest Wisconsin. * WHEN...Until 8 AM CDT this morning.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 5:13AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...LOCALLY DENSE FOG AFFECTING AREAS IN NORTH CENTRAL TO NORTHEAST MINNESOTA... Areas of locally dense fog will affect areas along and south of the Iron Range and along the Minnesota-Wisconsin border, including the cities of Brainerd, Walker, Grand Rapids, Aitkin, Moose Lake, and Siren. entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Visibility a quarter of a mile or less in dense fog. * WHERE...Wetzel, Brooke, Marshall, and Ohio Counties in West Virginia. * WHEN...Until 10 AM EDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Low visibility could make driving conditions hazardous.
